alert.note: Alert for Lower Clark Fork Region (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 01 at 9:04PM MST until February 02 at 3:00AM MST by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM MST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 4 inches. A brief period of intense snow and gusty easterly winds will develop late this evening. Areas of blowing snow and icy roadways will impact travel conditions. * WHERE...Evaro Hill, Highway 200 Thompson Falls to Plains, Highway 200 Trout Creek to Heron, and I-90 Lookout Pass to Haugan. * WHEN...Until 3 AM MST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be affected. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The cold wind chills as low as 15 below zero could result in hypothermia if precautions are not taken.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
